required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Evaluation of the Lower Limb Function After Femur Fracture's Operation Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: The Evaluation of the Lower Limb Function After Femur Fracture's Operation Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is the evaluation of lower limb function and the quaility of life of the patients after femur fracture operation treatment. LLTQ (Lower-Limb Tasks Questionnaire), LEFS (Lower Extremity Funcional Scale), LLFI-10 (Lower Limb Functional Index - 10) and LLFI (Lower Limb Functional Index) will be used for all the patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
All four questionnaires (LLTQ, LEFS LLFI-10 and LLFI) will be translated and adopted to the Polish conditions. The detailed medical/ epidemiological history will be collected in each patient. The fracture will be assessed based on the x-ray examination and will be qualified according to AO classification. NRS (Numerical Rating Scale) will be used to assess the pain intensity. SF36, QoL, CSQ, COPE and HADS questionnaire will be used to evaluate patient's the quality of life (subjective assessment). First assessment will be done before operation and then after 3, 6, 12, 24 month postoperation treatment.
With this main study, there is a plan to assess not only femur fractures patients, but the investigators would like to have addtional groups of the patients with hip and knee allopasty and knee arthroscopy with slightly different follow-up period: before the oparation, 1 and 12 month after the treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective assessment of the lower limb function
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire, score scale - according to the description in questionnaire, lower score- worse outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Objective assessment of the lower limb function

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective assessment of the lower limb function
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire, score scale - according to the description in questionnaire, lower score- worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective assessment of the lower limb function

arm_group.description: Stabilization of femur fracture according to the AO fundation guidelines
Resection of the meniscus lesion or anterior cruciatus ligamentum reconstruction

intervention.description: surgical treatment of femur fracture, hip and knee alloplasty, knee arthroscopy

study_pop.textblock: All patients planned for the surgical interventions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed Patient Informed Consent
- Patients planned for the surgical treatment
Exclusion Criteria: n.a.
